pullRequest.title: Implement v1.0.0 message ID calculation
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
Implements the Gossip message-id calculation based on uncompressed payload (spec)
The naive approach could be just change the Gossip messageIdGenerator which uncompressed the Snappy-compressed message payload and calculates the ID. However this approach would require uncompressing the message content twice:

on id calculation
on message decoding

To handle this from the Libp2p side the following features were implemented: libp2p/jvm-libp2p#155
From Teku side the GossipEncoding.decode method was split onto

prepareMessage which creates an abstract preprocessed PreparedGossipMessage instance which decompresses the payload lazily and caches decompressed payload
decodeMessage which consumes preprocessed PreparedGossipMessage instance and makes use of cached decompressed payload

The similar modification was made for TopicHandler interface
Depends on publishing 0.6.0 release: libp2p/jvm-libp2p#156
Fixed Issue(s)
Fix #3088
Fix #2951 (this PR is the last part of spec v1.0.0-rc0 upgrade)
Documentation

 I thought about documentation and added the documentation label to this PR if updates are required.

Add Log4j dependencies which were transitively pulled from Libp2p before

Add GossipMessage and GossipMessageFactory interfaces to abstract over gossip message and add possibility to decompress a message just once on earlier stage for calculating message-id and reuse decompressed payload when the message is actually handled
